p: Odee et al. [ 23], hypothesized a recent east to west range expansion of African populations of Senegalia senegal using sequences of ITS and psbA. They illustrated that West African S. senegal was represented by a single genetic group (nuclear), or two haplotypes (chloroplast), respectively. However, the data set in the study was characterized by a low resolution for intraspecific differentiation and contained a sampling gap in the SSZ of West Africa. Our study unveiled more diversity and population structure in S. senegal ( Table 2, Table 3), thus suggesting a more complex pattern than previously reported for this region.
